title:
The Penults of Tak: Adventures in impartial, normal-play, positional
  games
authors:
Boris Alexeev, Paul Ellis, Michael Richter, Thotsaporn Aek
  Thanatipanonda
abstract:
For normal play, impartial games, we define penults as those positions in
which every option results in an immediate win for the other player. We explore
the number of tokens in penults of two positional games, Impartial Tic and
Impartial Tak. We obtain a complete classification in the former case. We then
explore winning strategies and further directions.
